properties.name: quartz.enabled
properties.description: if auto configuration is enabled

properties.name: quartz.metrics.enabled
properties.description: if metrics configuration is enabled

properties.name: quartz.metrics.listener-name
properties.description: Optional: a name for the MetricsListener. If no name provided by configuration the class name will be used.

properties.name: quartz.metrics.enable-job-group-counter
properties.description: if metrics for counting fired job groups should be enabled

properties.name: quartz.metrics.enable-job-counter
properties.description: if metrics for counting fired jobs should be enabled

properties.name: quartz.metrics.enable-trigger-counter
properties.description: if metrics for counting fired triggers should be enabled

properties.name: quartz.metrics.enable-execution-instruction-counter
properties.description: if metrics for final instructions per job/trigger should be enabled

properties.name: quartz.metrics.enable-job-gauges
properties.description: if metrics for gauge of fired jobs should be enabled

properties.name: quartz.metrics.enable-trigger-gauges
properties.description: if metrics for gauge of fired triggers should be enabled

properties.name: quartz.persistence.persisted
properties.description: should be set to true if quartz is configured to persist its data to a database

properties.name: quartz.persistence.use-platform-tx-manager
properties.description: Only if quartz.persisted=true. if the PlatformTransactionManager should be used. Must be configured as Bean.

properties.name: quartz.persistence.platform-tx-manager-bean-name
properties.description: Only if quartz.persisted=true. if there are more than one PlatformTransactionManagers within the context you can specify the bean name, which txManager to use.

properties.name: quartz.persistence.data-source-name
properties.description: Only if quartz.persisted=true. If more than one database connection is configured the name (case-sensitive) of the used DataSource must be configured.

properties.name: quartz.scheduler-factory.schedulerName
properties.description: Optional: a name for the scheduler

properties.name: quartz.scheduler-factory.auto-startup
properties.description: Set whether to automatically start the scheduler after initialization.

properties.name: quartz.scheduler-factory.wait-for-jobs-to-complete-on-shutdown
properties.description: Set whether to wait for running jobs to complete on shutdown.

properties.name: quartz.scheduler-factory.overwrite-existing-jobs
properties.description: Set whether any jobs defined on this scheduler-factoryBean should overwrite existing job definitions.

properties.name: quartz.scheduler-factory.expose-scheduler-in-repository
properties.description: Set whether to expose the Spring-managed Scheduler instance in the Quartz SchedulerRepository.

properties.name: quartz.scheduler-factory.phase
properties.description: Specify the phase in which this scheduler should be started and stopped. The startup order proceeds from lowest to highest, and the shutdown order is the reverse of that.

properties.name: quartz.scheduler-factory.startup-delay
properties.description: Set the number of seconds to wait after initialization before starting the scheduler asynchronously. Default is 0, meaning immediate synchronous startup on initialization of this bean.

properties.name: quartz.properties-config-location
properties.description: Optional: a different resource location for quartz internal properties. (http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.x/configuration/ConfigMain.html)

properties.name: quartz.properties
properties.description: Optional: option to manage quartz internal properties via spring application properties. (http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.x/configuration/ConfigMain.html)

properties.name: quartz.override-config-location-properties
properties.description: If true, the properties from spring application will override the exsisting quartz properties from quartz.properties-config-location. If false only Springs quartz.properties.* will be used with fallback to file if empty.
